title.narrative: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: A functional child-friendly justice system is in place that includes prevention mechanisms and alternatives to detention sanctions, and is in line with international standards, in selected governorates., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, an increased proportion of children, who are vulnerable and exposed to violence, including those in humanitarian situations, are protected by prevention and response services, a supportive institutional and legislative framework and protective social norms.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A functional child-friendly justice system is in place that includes prevention mechanisms and alternatives to detention sanctions,and is in line with international standards, in selected governorates.

description.narrative: An increasing number of children in conflict with the law have benefited from diversion and non-custodial sentences and those in detention have access to legal assistance, case management, PSS, recreation and vocational education. Efforts to improve prevention and quality after-care services continue. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2019
